page.title: 04New Industries in Shepley.
page.content: In 1965 Victoria Mills closed down. The premises remain and are almost completely re-occupied by smaller businesses. We visited several of these. Victoria Glass was in a smaller unit and established two years ago. It is run by three people who buy glass to make into sealed units for double glazing. They also make plastic and aluminium window frames and hope to eventually expand. Transcontinental Goldfish Company occupies a bigger area and imports and sells a large variety of fish. They also sell domestic pets and are quite a local attraction. Lastly we visited Sheply Textile Machinery Merchants. This large unit is used for storing machines bought from mills which are being demolished. Old machines are not actually restored here but the main office is here.
